content:
When using Einstein Reply Recommendations, itâ€™s helpful to understand how we identify replies and recommend them to agents at runtime.

Identifying Reply Candidates

Einstein learns from past chat transcripts and clusters similar, common agent utterances. It identifies potential reply templates from these clusters of similar messages. Select and edit useful candidate templates before publishing them to Quick Text for your agents to use in chats with customers.

Recommending Replies at Runtime

Real-time natural language processing (NLP) is used to identify data patterns in live chats. When trained, Einstein analyzes past chats and learns the patterns of agent utterances and conversation that preceded them. It uses this understanding to predict which published reply template is most similar to what agents said in past chats.

Things To Keep In Mind

Involve agents in identifying ideal reply templates as they know products, common problems, and quick solutions. Avoid lengthy or overly specific templates. Make replies broad so agents can apply them to different customers or issues. Design replies to reflect situations that agents encounter regularly.
title: Einstein Reply Recommendations Key Concepts
